You can create an T3MovingAverage indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the T3MovingAverage constructor.

T3MovingAverage()1/2

            T3MovingAverage QuantConnect.Indicators.T3MovingAverage (
     string    name,
     int       period,
     *decimal  volumeFactor
   )

Initializes a new instance of the T3MovingAverage class using the specified name and period.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The period of the T3MovingAverage.
*decimal volumeFactor (Optional) /. Default: 0.7m

Return

T3MovingAverage - The new T3MovingAverage indicator object.

T3MovingAverage - The new T3MovingAverage indicator object.

Definition at line 52 of file Indicators/T3MovingAverage.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.


private T3MovingAverage _t3;

// In Initialize()
_t3 = new T3MovingAverage(name, period);
_t3.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _t3, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_t3.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _t3.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.t3 = T3MovingAverage(name, period)
self.t3.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.t3, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.t3.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.t3.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

    
private T3MovingAverage _t3;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_t3 = new T3MovingAverage(period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _t3.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_t3.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _t3.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.t3 = T3MovingAverage(period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.t3.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.t3.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.t3.Current.Value
